document.title: PROVISIONAL GUIDANCE ON USE OF CHEMICAL CATEGORIES

title.emphasis: Example of a targeted chemical category

appendix.para: Below is a summary of an example of a targeted category. For illustrative purposes a very simple and restrictive example is chosen. This example does not constitute a proposal for agreement by member countries. The reporting format as outlined in the OECD Guidance on Grouping of Chemicals [see ENV/JM/MONO(2007)28] is used below.

section.para: The chemical category is: saturated aliphatic C2-C8 (linear and branched) thiols
The only endpoint covered is 96h LC50 for fish. Furthermore, reliable results for Log Kow have to be available for all chemicals assessed in this category.

The domain of the category is defined by structure only: only saturated linear and branched aliphatic thiols with chain lengths between C2 and C8 are members of the category. No other functional groups are allowed in the structure. Furthermore structures with more than one thiol moiety are excluded.
